issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Reseved Resource for QueueMetrics needs to be decremented correctly in cases like below:
- when a reserved container is allocated
- when node is lost/ disconnected.
fields.summary: Reserved Resource for QueueMetrics needs to be handled correctly in few cases

comments.body:
Attaching an initial patch.
Added test cases
- Allocated a container which was earlier reserved
- Marked a node as removed in CS. This is similar case when a node is marked and DECOMMISIONED or UNHELTHY.

[~leftnoteasy] thoughts?
Thanks [~sunilg], will commit when Jenkins gets back.

This message was automatically generated.
TestNodeLabelContainerAllocation.testQueueUsedCapacitiesUpdate test case failure is related, I will update the patch.

After analysis I found that this issue is not related to the fix made by this patch or earlier rather its a timing issue. YARN-4890 is tracking this problem and a patch is shared there.

Other webservices failures are due to "Address already in use" pblm. YARN-4909 is tracking this sporadic issue. Other issues are know pblms due to DNS.
